Single Diagram

Diagram 1, Image

The diagram depicts two types of network attacks, internal and external. A brief description of each is given below:

External Attack
The diagram depicts a server (www.x y z corp.com) situated at X Y Z Corp. A hacker is working from his home. The hacker connects to the server via the Internet, and performs an attack on the server, causing it to stop working, or become unavailable.

Internal Attack
The diagram depicts the X Y Z Corp. internal network. There are three hosts connected via a switch. A hacker working from inside the building is attempting to access the network, via the switch.

There is a speech bubble above the hacker that reads, "Top Secret."
